body:
You realize that the outcome here, @sorpaas, is going to be the effective death of Multi-Geth?

Classic Geth will be END-of-LIFE after Agharta.
You can obviously add support to Parity-Ethereum.
Hyperledger Besu won't support your "Ethereum Classic Classic" flavor.

So Ethereum Classic will end up with Parity-Ethereum (majority client) and Hyperledger Besu (minority client) only for Aztlan HF.    Maybe I can get Mantis revived too by March as a third client?

But Multi-Geth will only be used on Ethereum Classic Classic.

I actually personally like that outcome for clients, to be honest, because Geth has an unsolvable backlog of IP risks (no known provenance for contributions, GPLv3 licensing which restricts who can use it).

I have long stated that I think the whole Geth-family will likely die out in the next couple of years because of these IP issues:

- Geth
- Classic Geth
- Multi-Geth
- TurboGeth (will prove @ledgerwatch's ideas on data-structures, but not a long life itself)
- JPM Quorum
- Clearmatics Autonity
- Axioni AxCore

Your actions here would just accelerate that process.
